comments.body: Would be nice if the module could also support check mode (though that's for another PR). :)
absolutely agree with you:) I noticed that it is not an attribute of all (or almost all) mysql modules unfortunately
How about moving this in the main `if:` branch above? Then there's no need to do funny tricks for `mysqlvar_val` in the `elif:` branch.
i changed the code but not in this part. Could you take another look and suggest a definite solution if it is still relevant

@felixfontein , i think it should be rewritten totally with keeping existing interfaces and their behavior. I'm going to do this soon (+ check_mode support).
I believe all of strange things (including checks) will be removed there.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +227,231 @@
    mysqlvar_val = getvariable(cursor, mysqlvar)
    if mysqlvar_val is None:
        module.fail_json(msg="Variable not available \"%s\"" % mysqlvar, changed=False)
